intro: Psychotria sessilis var. hancorniifolia, commonly known as the red-eyed beauty, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, with a dark green coloration. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
